cell.name: PurkinjeCell
cell.meta:notes: A very simplified Purkinje Cell for testing purposes only

cell.name: GranuleCell
cell.meta:notes: A very simplified cerebellar Granule like Cell for testing purposes only

cell.name: MossyFiber
cell.meta:notes: A simple cell for testing purposes only

channel_type.name: KConductance

status.meta:comment: Equations adapted from HH paper for modern convention of external potential being zero

channel_type.meta:notes: Simple example of K conductance in squid giant axon. Based on channel from Hodgkin and Huxley 1952

meta:publication.meta:fullTitle: A. L. Hodgkin and A. F. Huxley, A quantitative description of membrane current and its application to conduction and excitation in nerve, J. Physiol., vol. 117, pp. 500-544, 1952.

channel_type.name: NaConductance

status.meta:comment: Equations adapted from HH paper for modern convention of external potential being zero

channel_type.meta:notes: Simple example of Na conductance in squid giant axon. Based on channel from Hodgkin and Huxley 1952

meta:publication.meta:fullTitle: A. L. Hodgkin and A. F. Huxley, A quantitative description of membrane current and its application to conduction and excitation in nerve, J. Physiol., vol. 117, pp. 500-544, 1952.

channel_type.name: PassiveCond
channel_type.meta:notes: Simple example of a leak/passive conductance. Note: for GENESIS cells with a single leak conductance, it is better to use the Rm and Em variables for a passive current.

synapse_type.name: GranPurkSyn
synapse_type.meta:notes: Simple example of a synaptic mechanism, which consists of a postsynaptic conductance which changes as double exponential function of time. Mappings exist for NEURON and GENESIS.

synapse_type.name: MFExtSynInput
synapse_type.meta:notes: Simple example of a synaptic mechanism, which consists of a postsynaptic conductance which changes as double exponential function of time. Mappings exist for NEURON and GENESIS.

synapse_type.name: MFGranSyn
synapse_type.meta:notes: Simple example of a synaptic mechanism, which consists of a postsynaptic conductance which changes as double exponential function of time. Mappings exist for NEURON and GENESIS.
